TITLE: AI won an art contest, and artists are furious
SUMMARY: Jason M. Allen was almost too nervous to enter his first art competition. Now, his award-winning image is sparking controversy about whether art can be generated by a computer, and what, exactly, it means to be an artist.

TITLE: How airlines give you internet access at 35,000 feet — and why it still needs a lot of work
SUMMARY: Flights used to be a chance to sit back (albeit a bit cramped) and watch a recently released movie or catch up on some reading. Now they're just another place to log on.

TITLE: US internet service company blocks controversial online forum citing 'imminent threats to human life'
SUMMARY: Cloudflare, a major American internet services company, pulled its support for Kiwi Farms, a controversial online message board, Saturday evening citing "imminent threats to human life." The move temporarily forced Kiwi Farms offline.

TITLE: Instagram fined $400 million for failing to protect children's data
SUMMARY: Ireland's data privacy regulator has agreed to levy a record fine of 405 million euros ($402 million) against social network Instagram following an investigation into its handling of children's data, a spokesperson for the watchdog said.

TITLE: What to expect at Apple's 'far out' iPhone 14 event
SUMMARY: Apple is expected to debut its iPhone 14 lineup at the company's annual September keynote event on Wednesday.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes asks court for a new trial after alleging a key witness has regrets
SUMMARY: Elizabeth Holmes, the founder of failed blood testing startup Theranos who was convicted of fraud earlier this year, is asking for a new trial after claiming that a key witness visited her house unannounced and allegedly said he "feels guilty" about his testimony.

TITLE: Here's why it's taking NASA so long to attempt another Artemis I launch
SUMMARY: NASA has a plan for repairs to the massive new moon rocket after its latest attempt to launch an uncrewed test mission. It will be at least a few weeks before the rocket can make its next attempt. Here's why.

TITLE: Trans activist celebrates rare victory against online trolls after Kiwi Farms deplatforming
SUMMARY: Clara Sorrenti, a trans activist who was forced to flee her home in Canada after users of a hate-filled website targeted her, has succeeded in her campaign to get the site taken offline, for now.

TITLE: Japan is using snow to cool a data center
SUMMARY: A city in Japan has found a way to cool the vast servers that support the global digital economy without fueling the climate crisis.

TITLE: Apple set to unveil iPhone 14 at 'far out' event
SUMMARY: Apple is set to hold its big September press event where the company is widely expected to unveil the iPhone 14 lineup. Follow live here

TITLE: Judge denies Elon Musk's request to delay Twitter trial following whistleblower disclosure
SUMMARY: A Delaware judge on Wednesday denied Elon Musk's request to delay his trial with Twitter over their $44 billion acquisition deal after a former top executive alleged the company has serious security vulnerabilities.

TITLE: These companies are looking at using rockets to blast cargo across the planet
Apple unveils iPhone 14 at 'far out' event
SUMMARY: Apple held its big September press event where the company unveiled the iPhone 14 lineup, a new Apple Ultra watch and more. Follow live here.

TITLE: Apple announces satellite emergency SOS feature for iPhone 14
SUMMARY: Apple announced a forthcoming satellite connectivity feature called Emergency SOS via Satellite at its iPhone 14 launch event. The tool is intended to help people using the company's next-generation phones to communicate when their cell service isn't working — a process that Apple said took years to make a reality.

TITLE: Apple unveils new iPhones, Apple Watches and AirPods
SUMMARY: Apple unveiled its new iPhone 14 lineup at a press event on Wednesday, along with three new Apple Watch models, an update to its popular AirPods product line and a feature that could save lives when cell service isn't available.

TITLE: Amazon has no plan to make workers return to the office, CEO Andy Jassy says
SUMMARY: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy isn't looking to force the company's workers back into the office anytime soon.

TITLE: Amazon stops selling seatbelt alarm defeat devices in India
SUMMARY: Amazon has stopped selling devices that can disable seatbelt alarms in India following a request from the government.

TITLE: Russians will be able to buy the iPhone 14
SUMMARY: Russians will have the chance to buy the new Apple iPhone 14, despite the US tech company having left the country, thanks to Moscow's parallel import scheme, a senior government official told the RIA Novosti news agency on Thursday.

TITLE: Disney believed Twitter had 'substantial' numbers of fake accounts when it weighed acquisition in 2016, ex-CEO says
SUMMARY: Disney's analysis of Twitter in connection with a potential 2016 acquisition led the entertainment giant to conclude that "substantial" numbers of accounts on the social media service were fake, according to former Disney CEO Bob Iger.

TITLE: Amazon will stop selling seatbelt alarm defeat devices in India
SUMMARY: Amazon will halt the sale of devices that can disable seatbelt alarms in India following a request from the government.

TITLE: Apple's latest products and features take aim at our greatest fears
SUMMARY: If you only tuned into the opening of Apple's iPhone event this week, you might have wondered whether you were watching an emergency first responder training session.

TITLE: NASA eyes two dates in late September for Artemis I launch but several hurdles remain
SUMMARY: NASA has two new date in mind — September 23 or September 27 — for the next attempt at launching its massive new moon rocket on an uncrewed test mission. But there are still several hurdles that could stand in the way, any of which could push the launch date back further.

TITLE: Amazon will halt the sale of seatbelt alarm defeat devices in India
SUMMARY: Amazon will halt the sale of devices that can disable seatbelt alarms in India following a request from the government.

TITLE: Trump media merger isn't dead yet after deal gets a lifeline
SUMMARY: Digital World Acquisition Corp., the blank-check firm seeking to merge with former President Donald Trump's media venture, announced Friday it will avoid an imminent liquidation.

TITLE: Tesla considering lithium refinery in Texas, seeks tax relief
SUMMARY: Tesla Inc (TSLA) is considering setting up a lithium refinery on the gulf coast of Texas, as it looks to secure supply of the key component used in batteries amid surging demand for electric vehicles.

TITLE: Apple is ditching physical SIM cards. Here's what you should know
SUMMARY: The days of using a paper clip to perform microsurgery to extract a tiny SIM card from a little tray in your iPhone may be coming to an end.

TITLE: Why wireless carriers are offering the new iPhone for 'free'
SUMMARY: The unveiling of the latest iPhone 14 lineup earlier this week has already spurred a flurry of new promotions from wireless giants including AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon.

TITLE: Blue Origin 'responding to an issue' after abort system activated on uncrewed launch
SUMMARY: Blue Origin experienced an "anomaly" during an uncrewed launch of its New Shepard rocket from West Texas on Monday morning, triggering an abort system that allowed the capsule to parachute to Earth.

TITLE: Blue Origin rocket experiences 'booster failure,' activates abort system during uncrewed launch
SUMMARY: A Blue Origin rocket experienced a "booster failure" during an uncrewed launch of its New Shepard rocket from West Texas on Monday morning, triggering an abort system that allowed the capsule to parachute to Earth.

TITLE: Twitter's whistleblower is set to testify on Capitol Hill. Here's what to expect
SUMMARY: Twitter whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko is set to testify before Congress Tuesday in his first public appearance since his bombshell allegations against the social media company were reported last month by CNN and The Washington Post.

TITLE: Twitter pushes back at Elon Musk's attempt to exit deal over purported whistleblower payout
SUMMARY: Twitter on Monday pushed back at a new attempt by Elon Musk to walk away from their $44 billion acquisition deal over a payment the company is said to have made to a former employee who later turned whistleblower, calling the billionaire's move "invalid and wrongful."

TITLE: Extreme California heat knocks key Twitter data center offline
SUMMARY: Extreme heat in California has left Twitter without one of its key data centers, and a company executive warned in an internal memo obtained by CNN that another outage elsewhere could result in the service going dark for some of its users.

TITLE: Apple iOS 16 is now available for download
SUMMARY: Apple on Monday released its next-generation mobile software, iOS 16, with new features that allow users to personalize their iPhone lock screens and change how they text friends through iMessage.

TITLE: Twitter's whistleblower goes to Congress to warn of global security threats
SUMMARY: Twitter whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko is set to testify before Congress Tuesday in his first public appearance since his bombshell allegations against the social media company were reported last month by CNN and The Washington Post.

TITLE: US lawmakers question Twitter on security practices on eve of whistleblower testimony
SUMMARY: US lawmakers sent Twitter more than a dozen questions about its security practices Monday, on the eve of a company whistleblower's testimony before Congress in which he is expected to outline damning allegations of security and privacy vulnerabilities at the embattled social media company.

TITLE: Twitter's whistleblower set to testify before Senate committee
SUMMARY: In his first public appearance since his bombshell allegations were first reported, Twitter whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko is set to testify before Congress at 10 a.m. ET today. He has alleged Twitter has undisclosed security and privacy vulnerabilities. Follow live here

TITLE: Twitter's whistleblower testifies before Senate committee
SUMMARY: In his first public appearance since his bombshell allegations were first reported, Twitter whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko is testifying before Congress today. He has alleged Twitter has undisclosed security and privacy vulnerabilities. Follow live here

TITLE: Uber and its subsidiary pay New Jersey $100 million in back taxes
SUMMARY: Uber and one of its subsidiaries paid $100 million to New Jersey after an audit by the state's Department of Labor and Workforce Development determined the ride-share company improperly classified hundreds of thousands of drivers as independent contractors.

TITLE: Twitter shareholders vote in favor of Elon Musk's $44 billion takeover deal
SUMMARY: Elon Musk may be fighting tooth-and-nail to get out of his deal to buy Twitter, but the social media company's shareholders plan to hold him to it.

TITLE: Twitter is unable to catch and remove foreign agents in its ranks, whistleblower testifies
SUMMARY: Twitter lacks the resources and motivation to search for and remove foreign intelligence threats within its operations even as it has received warnings of possible spies in its ranks, former head of security Peiter "Mudge" Zatko told lawmakers in his first public appearance since blowing the whistle on the company.

TITLE: Twitter shareholders vote overwhelmingly in favor of Elon Musk's $44 billion takeover deal
SUMMARY: Elon Musk may be fighting tooth-and-nail to get out of his deal to buy Twitter, but the social media company's shareholders plan to hold him to it.

TITLE: Google loses appeal against record $4 billion EU fine
SUMMARY: Google suffered one of its biggest setbacks on Wednesday when a top European court fined it 4.125 billion euros ($4.13 billion) for using its Android mobile operating system to thwart rivals, offering a precedent for other regulators to ratchet up pressure.

TITLE: California AG sues Amazon over allegedly anticompetitive pricing contracts
SUMMARY: California's attorney general sued Amazon on Wednesday, alleging the company has forced third-party sellers to offer only their lowest prices in listings with the e-commerce giant and harming competition in the process.

TITLE: TikTok won't commit to stopping US data flows to China
SUMMARY: TikTok repeatedly declined to commit to US lawmakers on Wednesday that the short-form video app will cut off flows of US user data to China, instead promising that the outcome of its negotiations with the US government "will satisfy all national security concerns."

TITLE: The world's second biggest cryptocurrency just got a lot greener
SUMMARY: Ethereum, the world's second most valuable cryptocurrency, has completed a massive software upgrade that its backers claim will slash its carbon footprint.

TITLE: UK launches deeper antitrust probe of Microsoft's Activision deal
SUMMARY: UK officials have launched a deeper antitrust investigation into Microsoft's $68.7 billion purchase of video game giant Activision Blizzard, reflecting concerns that the deal may lead to reduced competition.

TITLE: Zoom hit by brief outage
SUMMARY: Zoom was hit by a brief outage Thursday morning, potentially disrupting some of the many users who have come to rely on it for meetings during the pandemic.

TITLE: Adobe builds collaborative design muscle with $20 billion deal for Figma
SUMMARY: Adobe Inc will buy startup Figma for about $20 billion in its biggest deal, the Photoshop maker said on Thursday, bulking up on applications that support online collaboration amid a global shift to hybrid working.

TITLE: You could soon receive even more emails after shopping on Amazon
SUMMARY: If you've ever worried you weren't getting enough emails from businesses trying to sell you things, you're in luck.

TITLE: TikTok clones rival with real-time sharing feature
SUMMARY: After years of larger competitors copying TikTok, the short-form video app is now copying a newer rival.

TITLE: Amazon is about to stream its first 'Thursday Night Football' game. Here's what will change
SUMMARY: Amazon is about to make its "Thursday Night Football" streaming debut, and it's hoping to enhance the broadcast experience enough to keep viewers coming back.

TITLE: Elon Musk has publicly filed updated counterclaims against Twitter based on whistleblower disclosure
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's legal team on Thursday filed a public version of its updated counterclaims in response to Twitter's lawsuit seeking to force the billionaire to follow through with his $44 billion deal to buy the company.

TITLE: California Gov. Newsom signs landmark legislation aimed at boosting children's safety online
SUMMARY: A landmark California bill aimed at promoting children's digital welfare became law on Thursday, as Gov. Gavin Newsom announced he had signed the legislation imposing strict requirements on websites "likely to be accessed" by kids.

TITLE: Uber investigating 'cybersecurity incident' after hacker claims to access internal systems
SUMMARY: Uber said Thursday that it was investigating a "cybersecurity incident" after a hacker shared evidence that they had breached the ride-hailing giant's computer systems with journalists and security researchers.

TITLE: The biggest change to the new iPhone isn't the hardware
SUMMARY: When iPhone 14 users aren't using their new Apple device, the screen is hardly asleep. It'll remain lit with prominently displayed widgets such as alarms, calendar appointments and sports scores flittering with real-time updates, and be at the ready if you glance down or inevitably pick it back up.

TITLE: At Twitter whistleblower hearing, a key tech regulator comes under fire
SUMMARY: When a Twitter whistleblower testified at an explosive Senate hearing this week, the social media company wasn't the only one to come under fire. Lawmakers on both sides of the aisle repeatedly criticized federal regulators who for years had supposedly been keeping a close eye on the company.

TITLE: What you need to know about the new edit and unsend options for iMessage
SUMMARY: Apple has delivered on two of its most requested features: the ability to edit and unsend iMessages.

TITLE: Federal appeals court upholds controversial Texas social media law restricting content moderation
SUMMARY: A federal appeals court on Friday upheld a controversial Texas law that restricts the ability of Facebook, Twitter and YouTube to moderate content on their platforms, setting up a potential Supreme Court showdown while also renewing uncertainties about how tech platforms may operate in the state in the future.

TITLE: The 40-year evolution from :-) to 😂
SUMMARY: At 11:44 a.m. on September 19, 1982, Scott Fahlman made internet history by stitching together a colon, a hyphen and a close parenthesis.

TITLE: Why deleting something from the internet is 'almost impossible'
SUMMARY: Most people may live out their digital lives with the assumption they can delete their posts, messages and personal data from services whenever they choose. But a tech hearing this week threw that core assumption into question.
